description.narrative: In Cote d'Ivoire, rural farming women are among the most marginalized members of the population and have limited access to resources such as land, water, inputs, financing and training as well as to methods for preserving agricultural outputs. They have difficulties in transporting and selling agricultural products. These obstacles are further compounded by gender-based discrimination in the social realm including women's high illiteracy rates and lack of knowledge on rights and protections. Their precarious situation has been further exacerbated by the recent post-electoral crisis, which destroyed women's farming groups. This programme seeks to re-establish the groups and provide them with technical training and financing in the form of revolving funds. It will reach out to women through literacy classes, training in agricultural techniques, including adaptation to climate change, and agro-processing services. Moreover, it proposes to establish platforms/networks to link women producers, processors, transporters and marketers, cutting out other middlemen and enabling them to build a smoother value chain and share in the benefits and profits across different stages
